summary: Email correspondence between FBI personnel and a U.S. Attorney's Office (NY) representative discussing preparations for the imminent charging and arrest of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails coordinate meetings to review case files from Florida, secure physical evidence, and plan surveillance and arrest operations.

persons.name: Watson, Sean P.
persons.context: FBI agent in New York who is a recipient of the email chain discussing Epstein case preparations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation, with charging and arrest operations being planned against him.

connections.description: Watson is an FBI agent involved in planning the investigation and arrest of Epstein.

events.title: Planning for Epstein Charging and Arrest
events.description: Law enforcement officials coordinate to review case files from Florida, secure physical evidence, and plan surveillance and arrest operations for Jeffrey Epstein, noting an expedited timetable for charging within weeks.

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively planning the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein in June 2019 with an 'expedited timetable of charging in the next few weeks.'
Officials were coordinating to review the entire case file from Florida and secure all physical evidence before proceeding.
Plans included 'extensive operation around arrest time of multiple approaches' and surveillance, indicating a complex, high-priority law enforcement action.
